Rules

    Ethics and Etiquette

    i) All the global rules and guidelines hold in this game, and are not duplicated below.
    ii) Never link to or quote from any Private Topic provided by the mod. Loose paraphrasing should be fine.
    iii) Excessive coarse language should not be directed at other players. Frustration is natural, but keep it in check.
    iv) Don't impersonate the mod. They won't edit other people's posts except to fix tags; they won't leave other comments.
    v) Cryptography and steganography are forbidden, as are any forms of provable randomness (e.g. dice tags, random.org screenshots).
    vi) If you have outside information which alters your knowledge of the game or suspect the game has been compromised, contact the mod immediately.
    vii) Don't exploit technicalities or ambiguities in any of the rules to do something you should know is forbidden or unethical.

    Matters of Life and Death

    viii) A vote or unvote is valid so long as it contains the word 'vote' or 'unvote' directly followed by a player's name or 'no lynch', all in instantly readable unquoted bold text.
    ix) Abbreviations or misspellings of a player's name or 'no lynch' are valid whilst voting, so long as they are unambiguous.
    x) Votes and unvotes are invalid if they come from any account not listed as alive and presently in the game.
    xi) A lynch occurs when a player receives greater than 50% of all votes.
    xii) A no lynch occurs when greater than or equal to 50% of all votes are placed in favour.
    xiii) Players may continue talking after a lynch or no lynch has occurred until the mod announces it.
    xiv) Once the mod has announced their death, a player may not post further. This includes 'bah' posts.

    Actions, Activity, and Deadlines

    xv) The lengths of Day and Night phases are up to the mod but will generally be between 5 and 14 days and 48 and 72 hours respectively.
    xvi) If the Day deadline expires without a majority of votes on a player, nobody dies and the game moves into Night.
    xvii) If Day or Night actions are not submitted via PM or in bold in a mod-provided PT before deadline, they do not resolve.
    xviii) Players who do not wish to perform an available Day or Night action should submit 'no action' or risk being replaced.
    xix) Deadlines are extended only in exceptional circumstances or if a player needs replacement. No phase ends until all slots are occupied.
    xx) Players who do not post for 48 hours will be prodded. Not responding to a prod within 48 hours or receiving 4 prods will see that player replaced.
    xxi) If a player expects to be unable to post for upwards of 48 hours, they should declare V/LA legibly, in bold, in-thread, to avoid being prodded.

    Miscellaneous

    xxii) When in doubt, ask the mod.
    xxiii) Flavour will never have any significance, hidden or otherwise, to the game.
    xxiv) Punishment for breaking the rules is determined on a case-by-case basis, and may range from a warning to a modkill or replacement.
    xxv) The mod reserves the right to add, modify, or remove rules as necessary, but will not change relevant rules during or after the fact.

Setup

    The only thing you know about this setup is that it passed normalcy and balance reviews.

    Here is the Vanilla Townie role PM:
    Welcome to Mini 1703: Mafia on the Run, [playername]!

    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

    You are a Vanilla Townie.

    You have no abilities apart from your voice and your vote. Use them well!

    You win the game if:
      ### all Mafia- and self-aligned players are dead and at least one Town-aligned player is alive.
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

    Please confirm by replying to this PM with the name of your role.

    The game thread is here. Good luck, play fair, and have fun!
